snippet: Russia and Ukraine signaled a willingness to seek a diplomatic resolution, but Russia raised the possibility of suspending nuclear inspections, citing NATO operations.
abstract: Russia and Ukraine signal willingness to seek diplomatic resolution, but Russia begins moving new troops to Crimea and raises the possibility of suspending its nuclear inspections, citing stepped-up operations by NATO.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Moscow, and Steven Erlanger from Kiev, Ukraine. Reporting was contributed by Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev; Patrick Reevell from Simferopol, Ukraine; Noah Sneider from Bakhchysaray, Ukraine; Mark Landler from Coral Gables, Fla.; and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Russia and Ukraine signaled a willingness to seek a diplomatic resolution, but Russia raised the possibility of suspending nuclear inspections, citing NATO operations.

headline.main: Tensions Remain High in Crimea Amid Renewed Effort to Mediate
headline.print_headline: Tensions Remain High in Crimea Amid Renewed Effort to Mediate
